body_html:
This corner case happens when the dataset does not contain some particular classes in any image. When it happens, current implementation `under-estimates` the final result by setting some class IOU to be zero (thus the final mean IOU value decreases). On the other hand, the proposed method `over-estimates` the final result by setting those class IOU to be 1 (however they do not really appear in the dataset). To really fix this problem, I think it is better to compute the final mean IOU ONLY for those classes that indeed appear in the dataset. In the mentioned example, we will compute the mean IOU for only sky and road, which will then be 1. Liang-Chieh (Jay) Chen

body_text:
This corner case happens when the dataset does not contain some particular
classes in any image. When it happens, current implementation
`under-estimates` the final result by setting some class IOU to be zero
(thus the final mean IOU value decreases). On the other hand, the proposed
method `over-estimates` the final result by setting those class IOU to be 1
(however they do not really appear in the dataset). To really fix this
problem, I think it is better to compute the final mean IOU ONLY for those
classes that indeed appear in the dataset. In the mentioned example, we
will compute the mean IOU for only sky and road, which will then be 1.

Liang-Chieh (Jay) Chen

body:
This corner case happens when the dataset does not contain some particular
classes in any image. When it happens, current implementation
`under-estimates` the final result by setting some class IOU to be zero
(thus the final mean IOU value decreases). On the other hand, the proposed
method `over-estimates` the final result by setting those class IOU to be 1
(however they do not really appear in the dataset). To really fix this
problem, I think it is better to compute the final mean IOU ONLY for those
classes that indeed appear in the dataset. In the mentioned example, we
will compute the mean IOU for only sky and road, which will then be 1.

Liang-Chieh (Jay) Chen
